author: Michael Larabel
description: Google engineer Rahman Lavaee today announced their work on a prototype software implementation to automatically insert optimal code prefetches into binaries for faster performance, especially for the latest Intel Granite Rapids and AMD Turin processors with new prefetching instructions...
title: Google Develops Code Prefetch Insertion Optimizer For Faster Intel GNR & AMD Turin Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: While XP-PEN does provide out-of-tree drivers for their drawing tablets on Linux including the XP-PEN Artist 24 Pro, the Linux 6.19 kernel is set to provide upstream support for the XP-PEN Artist 24 Pro...
title: Linux 6.19 To Support The XP-PEN Artist 24 Pro Drawing Tablet

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Fedora Council has finally come to a decision on allowing AI-assisted contributions to the project. The agreed upon guidelines are fairly straight-forward and will permit AI-assisted contributions if it's properly disclosed and transparent...
title: Fedora Will Allow AI-Assisted Contributions With Proper Disclosure & Transparency

author: Michael Larabel
description: Announced today at the PyTorch Conference was word that the Ray AI compute engine is becoming a project hosted by the PyTorch Foundation...
title: Ray AI Engine Pulled Into The PyTorch Foundation For Unified Open AI Compute Stack

author: Michael Larabel
description: The EROFS read-only file-system continues enjoying nice uptick in use from embedded devices to containers. Merged today for Linux 6.18 is some new hardening to the EROFS driver where specially-crafted file-system images could lead to system crashes or infinite loops...
title: Linux 6.18 Hardened Against Specially-Crafted EROFS Images Leading To System Crashes

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged today to the LLVM/Clang compiler codebase are some long overdue adjustments to the AMD Zen 4 "znver4" CPU model for more accurately assessing various latency timings and micro-ops. These values were initially copied over from the Zen 3 (znver3) target but never adjusted properly for Zen 4 until now when an independent contributor took to sorting it out...
title: LLVM Lands Some Long Overdue Tuning Optimizations For AMD Zen 4

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those that happen to have the Dell G15 5530 laptop or considering this Intel Core i7 13650HX + NVIDIA GeForce RTX high-end laptop, the upcoming Linux 6.18 kernel is set to have AWCC platform profile support for this model as a nice enhancement. In turn this patch should also be back-ported to future stable Linux kernel point releases...
title: Linux 6.18 Adding AWCC Profile Support For The Dell G15 5530

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those that have been considering the ASUS ROG STRIX X870E-H GAMING WIFI7 motherboard for a high-end AMD Ryzen 9000 series desktop, sensor monitoring support will soon be working under Linux...
title: Linux 6.19 To Support Sensor Monitoring On The ASUS ROG STRIX X870E-H GAMING WIFI7

author: Michael Larabel
description: Theo de Raadt released OpenBSD 7.8 today as the newest feature release to this popular BSD operating system...
title: OpenBSD 7.8 Released With Raspberry Pi 5 Support, AMD SEV Enablement
